mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Questions the exclusion of the Irish-American from the Convention of the Friends of Ireland; wonders how Tyler, always a supporter of Irish Americans, could allow the "exclusion" of a newspaper of over 100,000 subscribers from such a Convention, of which Tyler is the Chairman. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1855 December 5, Patrick Lynch, New York, N.Y. to Robert Tyler, Astor Place House, New York, N.Y.
